name: HIPAA
fullName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act - Security Rule
governingBody: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
description: HIPAA establishes the definitive federal standard for protecting sensitive patient data. The Security Rule establishes national standards for protecting electronic Protected Health Information (ePHI). Covered Entities and Business Associates must implement Administrative, Physical, and Technical Safeguards. Specifications are designated as Required (R) or Addressable (A) - addressable does NOT mean optional.

lifecycle.name: Risk Analysis
lifecycle.description: Conduct a thorough risk analysis to identify threats and vulnerabilities to ePHI across all systems.

lifecycle.name: Risk Management & Safeguard Implementation
lifecycle.description: Implement Administrative, Physical, and Technical Safeguards to reduce identified risks to an acceptable level.

lifecycle.name: Policy and Procedure Development
lifecycle.description: Develop and document all required HIPAA policies and procedures.

lifecycle.name: Ongoing Compliance
lifecycle.description: Conduct periodic risk assessments, train employees, and maintain documentation.

domains.name: Technical Safeguards (ยง164.312)
domains.description: Technologies and policies that protect ePHI and govern access to it. The primary focal point for software engineering teams.

controls.name: Unique User Identification
controls.description: Assign a unique name and/or number for identifying and tracking user identity.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement unique user IDs for all system users. Prohibit shared accounts. Map all actions to individual users through audit trails.

controls.name: Emergency Access Procedure
controls.description: Establish and implement highly privileged, audited procedures for obtaining access to ePHI during an emergency.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define break-glass procedures. Implement emergency access accounts with enhanced auditing. Test procedures annually.

controls.name: Automatic Logoff
controls.description: Implement electronic procedures that terminate sessions after a predetermined period of inactivity.
controls.implementationGuidance: Configure session timeouts for all applications handling ePHI. Set idle timeout to 15 minutes max. Force re-authentication after timeout.

controls.name: Encryption and Decryption (at Rest)
controls.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt ePHI stored in databases and storage systems.
controls.implementationGuidance: Encrypt all ePHI at rest using AES-256. Implement key management procedures. Encrypt database columns containing ePHI.

controls.name: Audit Controls - Hardware/Software Logging
controls.description: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in systems containing or using ePHI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Log all access to ePHI. Record login attempts, data access, modifications, and deletions. Centralize logs in SIEM. Retain for 6+ years.

controls.name: Mechanism to Authenticate ePHI
controls.description: Implement electronic mechanisms to corroborate that ePHI has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement checksums or digital signatures for ePHI. Use database integrity checks. Validate data integrity through reconciliation.

controls.name: Person or Entity Authentication
controls.description: Implement procedures to verify the identity of a person or entity seeking access to ePHI, including multi-factor authentication.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement MFA for all systems containing ePHI. Verify user identity before granting access. Use strong authentication methods.

controls.name: Transmission Integrity Controls
controls.description: Implement security measures to ensure that electronically transmitted ePHI is not improperly modified without detection.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use TLS 1.2+ for all ePHI in transit. Implement message integrity checks (HMAC). Validate data integrity at endpoints.

controls.name: Encryption in Transit
controls.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt ePHI whenever it is transmitted over electronic communications networks, especially public networks.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce TLS 1.2+ for all API endpoints. Use IPsec for VPN connections. Encrypt email containing ePHI. Disable deprecated protocols.

domains.name: Administrative Safeguards (ยง164.308)
domains.description: Administrative actions, policies, and procedures to manage the selection, development, implementation, and maintenance of security measures to protect ePHI.

controls.name: Security Management Process - Risk Analysis
controls.description: Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct comprehensive risk analysis covering all ePHI. Document threats, vulnerabilities, likelihood, and impact. Update annually.

controls.name: Security Management Process - Risk Management
controls.description: Implement security measures sufficient to reduce risks and vulnerabilities to a reasonable and appropriate level.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop risk management plan. Implement controls based on risk analysis findings. Track remediation of identified risks.

controls.name: Workforce Security - Authorization and Supervision
controls.description: Implement procedures for the authorization and/or supervision of workforce members who work with ePHI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement role-based access. Authorize workforce members before granting ePHI access. Supervise access for new employees.

controls.name: Security Awareness and Training
controls.description: Implement a security awareness and training program for all workforce members.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct annual HIPAA security training. Include phishing awareness. Track completion. Provide role-specific training for IT staff.

controls.name: Security Incident Procedures
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents. Identify and respond to suspected or known security incidents.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop incident response plan. Define incident classification. Establish communication channels. Test with tabletop exercises.

controls.name: Contingency Plan
controls.description: Establish and implement policies and procedures for responding to an emergency or other occurrence that damages systems containing ePHI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop disaster recovery and business continuity plans. Implement data backup. Test restoration procedures. Define RTO/RPO.

controls.name: Business Associate Contracts
controls.description: Document satisfactory assurances from business associates that they will appropriately safeguard ePHI through Business Associate Agreements.
controls.implementationGuidance: Execute BAAs with all vendors handling ePHI. Include breach notification requirements. Require security program attestation.

breachNotification.threshold: 500+ affected individuals requires media notification and HHS 'wall of shame' posting
